alert.note: Alert for Itasca (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 21 at 11:10AM CDT until April 23 at 1:00PM CDT by NWS Duluth
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Minnesota... Snake River near Pine City affecting Pine County. Prairie River near Taconite affecting Itasca County. Mississippi River at Fort Ripley affecting Crow Wing and Morrison Counties. Mississippi River At Aitkin affecting Aitkin and Crow Wing Counties. .Snowmelt runoff combined with recent rainfall have pushed area rivers into flood stage. Cooler temperatures will help to slow additional runoff allowing some area rivers to crest. While the Mississippi at Aitkin continues a slow but steady rise as water routes through the Upper Mississippi Headwaters. Cool and dry weather conditions are forecast for the next several days so steady of falling flows are expected. There was additional snowfall added to these basins which will slowly melt during the week. However, forecast overnight temperatures drop below freezing. Keep in mind additional heavy precipitation in the future could cause further flooding. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY SUNDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Prairie River near Taconite. * WHEN...Until early Sunday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 10.0 feet, County Road 352 near Lawrence lake boat ramp becomes inundated. Flood waters cross County Road 319 near Crooked Lake. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:45 AM CDT Friday the stage was 10.5 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:45 AM CDT Friday was 10.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 10.5 feet this afternoon. It will remain steady of gradually fall in the week ahead. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 10.5 feet on 04/26/2008. - Flood safety information can be found at www.weather.gov/safety/flood. && Fld Observed Forecasts (1 pm CDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Sat Sun Mon Prairie River Taconite 10.0 10.5 Fri 9 am CDT 10.1 9.8 9.3 &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and to the National Weather Service in Duluth when you can do so safely. Flooding can be reported to the National Weather Service at 1-800-685-8612. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/duluth. The next statement will be issued Saturday evening by 615 PM CDT.
